page.title: 09Employment in Trefriw.
page.content: Most villagers are fully employed, apart from school leavers. Employment for men is mainly at the Aluminium Corporation Works at nearby Dolgarrog, and at the Trefriw Woollen Mill in the centre of Trefriw where 2O women and lO men are employed.Other work in the area includes farming and forestry in nearby conifer forests. The tourist industry is of great importance,contributing to the success of local shops, licensed premises, and restaurants.Accommodation is provided in 3 boarding houses,5 licensed restaurants, and several bed and breakfast establishments. One of the two caravan sites has received the "Wales in Bloom" award several years running from the Welsh Tourist Board. Other residents are retired, self-employed,or commute by car to more distant places of work.
